intro: Chytranthus villiger, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine, silky hairs. Chytranthus villiger is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water availability.
